# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that I want to wrap into multiple lines."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

The above function `wrap_string` will take in a `String` and an optional `Int` for the maximum text width. It iterates over each word in the `String` and checks if appending the current word to the line would exceed the specified text width. If so, it starts a new line. Finally, it joins all the lines back into a single string and returns it.
